text: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine dasāhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ
edit: Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine dasāhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ

translations.transtext: 1. When a bhikkhu has finished his robe and the frame is dismantled (his kathina privileges are ended), he is to keep extra robe-cloth ten days at most. Beyond that, it is to be forfeited and confessed.
๑. จีวรสำเร็จแล้ว กฐินอันภิกษุเดาะเสียแล้ว พึงทรงอติเรกจีวรได้ ๑๐ วันเป็นอย่างยิ่ง ภิกษุให้ล่วงกำหนดนั้นไป เป็นนิสสัคคิยปาจิตตีย์

1. (During a time) when (stored-up) cloth is finished up (by its being either all made up into robes or destroyed etc.) and when the kathina (privileges) are in abeyance an extra robe can be worn (or kept) by a bhikkhu for ten days at the most. When he exceeds that, it entails expiation with forfeiture.
